docs.snippet: In an evening in late June, Yasir al-Nuaimi draped an Iraqi flag over his shoulder and headed out to watch a soccer match being shown on television at a cafe in western Baghdad. The 20-year-old told his mother to pray for his team to win....
docs.lead_paragraph: In an evening in late June, Yasir al-Nuaimi draped an Iraqi flag over his shoulder and headed out to watch a soccer match being shown on television at a cafe in western Baghdad. The 20-year-old told his mother to pray for his team to win.

headline.main: Cafes Shut, Sports Fields Empty as War Returns to Iraq
headline.print_headline: Cafes Shut, Sports Fields Empty as War Returns to Iraq

docs.snippet: Six months after Australia's top criminal intelligence unit alleged widespread doping in Australian sport, investigators have interviewed dozens of athletes, compiled a brick-like report of their findings and failed to release the name of a single...
docs.lead_paragraph: Six months after Australia's top criminal intelligence unit alleged widespread doping in Australian sport, investigators have interviewed dozens of athletes, compiled a brick-like report of their findings and failed to release the name of a single offender.

headline.main: Doping-Cloud Still Over Australia Six Months After 'Blackest Day'
headline.print_headline: Doping-Cloud Still Over Australia Six Months After 'Blackest Day'

docs.snippet: Several media analysts suggested the standoff might be protracted, with predictions ranging from about 10 days to as long as six weeks....

docs.abstract: Fee dispute between CBS and Time Warner Cable continues, resulting in CBS television blackout in many areas, including large parts of New York, Los Angeles and Dallas; several media analysts suggest latest standoff might be protracted, with predictions ranging from about 10 days to as long as six weeks.

headline.main: A Wait for CBS and Time Warner Cable to Make Up
